newsitem.title: USA: Morgan Stanley shrs off after Q4 disappoints.
newsitem.headline: Morgan Stanley shrs off after Q4 disappoints.

text.p: Shares in Morgan Stanley Group Inc slipped 1-1/8 to 55-3/8 after the company reported lower than expected fourth quarter earnings.

Morgan Stanley's fourth quarter net income of $236 million, or $1.36 per fully diluted share, brought the firm's full year earnings to a record $1.03 billion for the fiscal year ended November 30, 1996.
Even so, the earnings fell short of Wall Street expectations, which averaged $1.51 per share, according to First Call's consensus estimate.

"Morgan Stanley came in light," said Raphael Soifer, a financial industry analyst at Brown Brothers Harriman. "I think there's probably a bit of disappointment, particularly with respect to expenses."
"The whole (financial) group is down, but Morgan is down even relative to the group," he added.
Morgan Stanley said its total expenses excluding interest costs rose 29 percent in the fourth quarter, essentially matching the firm's revenue growth rate.
In the fourth quarter, expenses rose to $1.15 billion from $892 million in the comparable 1995 period, while net revenues rose to $1.51 billion from $1.17 billion.

In contrast, earnings at Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc exceeded expectations, coming in at $0.96 per share for the fourth quarter, up from $0.49 a year ago and well above First Call's consensus estimate of $0.85.

"Everything went right for Lehman in the quarter," Soifer said, noting that Lehman's fourth quarter results improved despite the inclusion $0.43 per share non-recurring severance charge. "They had just a blockbuster of a quarter."

However, the news was not enough for Lehman to overcome a general decline in financial shares on Wall Street. Lehman shares, which rose early in the session, dipped 7/8 to 29-3/4 in mid-afternoon activity.
